name: Donaco
description:
Donaco is an Imperial College London social startup using novel AI techniques to facilitate online donations and shape content interaction. Using Artificial Intelligence, we dynamically embed a button in articles that recommends relevant charities and empowers readers to take action and donate on content that inspires them. This is done seamlessly within the article itself in just a few clicks. As stories drive interest, we drive people into action.


Its contextual technology has strong potential beyond donations into e-commerce, finance or bookings, bringing the paying point closer to readers and enabling one to take action based on their interest in the moment.


Key Achievements:
•	Winner of Microsoft UK Imagine Cup
•	Successful first pilot on local newspaper with high engagement rate
•	Secured ties with largest UK charities and in talks with media outlets
•	Entrepreneurs First (EF9) cohort and supported by Imperial Innovations

team.name: Michael Moses
team.bioHtml: Founder & CEO @Donaco, Recent Masters Graduate @Imperial College London, Startup business and Engineering background

team.name: Sam Williams
team.bioHtml: Student @Durham, Start-up experience @Donaco and @RedGoldCapital, Writer @BullionVault , Technical Assistant @MRIB, Experience @Deutsche, Crowdfunding Investor

jobs.title: Sales and Marketing Intern
jobs.description:
Description

We are looking for a sales and marketing intern to join us on our journey and work closely with the founding team in business development. This is a flexible part-time or full-time position.
​
Prior work in the charitable sector or PR/Communications is a plus and eager to have an impact on local communities and using technology for good. 
​

Key responsibilities may include

- Outreach to new media and charity partners
- Attending conferences and events on behalf of Donaco
- Developing marketing material, including presentations, newsletters, one-pagers
- Social media presence development
- Competition / Investment / Grants submissions 
​

Qualifications

- Minimum currently undertaking an undergraduate degree and beyond
- Motivated to have an impact and work in a fast-paced environment
- Prior work in the not-for-profit sector or PR/Communications or Media role are a plus
​

Benefits

- Flexible paid part-time position (min 2 days a week - TBD with the founding team)
- Unique opportunity to work in a fast-growing startup and play an important role in its growth
- Potential for longer-term full-time position with equity package
